means: 培养，促进( foster的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The centre aims to help disadvantaged areas of Europe, mainly by fostering new businesses.
sentence.Network_cn: 该中心旨在帮助欧洲的贫困地区，方法主要是通过扶持新型商业。

sentence.Network_en: She has since gone on to find happiness by fostering more than 100 children.
sentence.Network_cn: 从那以后她代养了100多个孩子，并从中得到快乐。

sentence.Network_en: Fostering is a full-time job and you should carefully consider how it will fit into your career.
sentence.Network_cn: 抚养孩子是全天候的事，应该仔细考虑如何将它与事业协调起来。

PerfectNetExp.abs: as well as increase investment in scientific research, so that we are fostering(哺育,养育) the industries and jobs of the future right here in America.
fostering 反哺, fostering 培植, fostering 发扬
on foreign trade innovation and fostering professional talent ., 外贸业务创新与专业人才培养问题初探.

the fourth section : to probe the level and function linguistic sense of chapter for fostering students " linguistic sense of chapter by way of Chinese teaching . "第四部分：为了能在教学实践中更好地培养中学生的篇章语感，对其层级和功能进行了探讨。

entry.def: Foster parents are people who officially take a child into their family for a period of time, without becoming the child's legal parents. The child is referred to as their foster child.

example.ex: Little Jack was placed with foster parents...
example.tran: 小杰克和养父母住在一起。

example.ex: The foster mother was a wonderful, warm person.
example.tran: 寄养母是一个很不错的热心人。

entry.def: If you foster a child, you take it into your family for a period of time, without becoming its legal parent.

example.ex: She has since gone on to find happiness by fostering more than 100 children.
example.tran: 从那以后她代养了 100 多个孩子，并从中得到快乐。

entry.def: To foster something such as an activity or idea means to help it to develop.

example.ex: He said that developed countries had a responsibility to foster global economic growth to help new democracies...
example.tran: 他说，发达国家有责任促进全球经济增长，以帮助新兴民主国家。

example.ex: Its cash crisis has been fostered by declining property values.
example.tran: 地产贬值引发了现金危机。

means.word_mean: 1. encouragement; aiding the development of something
2. raising someone to be an accepted member of the community;

sentences.sentence: "they debated whether nature or nurture was more important"
